title: 1003-E
statement: E. Tree Constructingtime limit per test4 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given three integers $$$n$$$, $$$d$$$ and $$$k$$$.Your task is to construct an undirected tree on $$$n$$$ vertices with diameter $$$d$$$ and degree of each vertex at most $$$k$$$, or say that it is impossible.An undirected tree is a connected undirected graph with $$$n - 1$$$ edges.Diameter of a tree is the maximum length of a simple path (a path in which each vertex appears at most once) between all pairs of vertices of this tree.Degree of a vertex is the number of edges incident to this vertex (i.e. for a vertex $$$u$$$ it is the number of edges $$$(u, v)$$$ that belong to the tree, where $$$v$$$ is any other vertex of a tree).InputThe first line of the input contains three integers $$$n$$$, $$$d$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \\le n, d, k \\le 4 \\cdot 10^5$$$).OutputIf there is no tree satisfying the conditions above, print only one word "NO" (without quotes).Otherwise in the first line print "YES" (without quotes), and then print $$$n - 1$$$ lines describing edges of a tree satisfying the conditions above. Vertices of the tree must be numbered from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$. You can print edges and vertices connected by an edge in any order. If there are multiple answers, print any of them.1ExamplesInput6 3 3OutputYES3 14 11 25 22 6Input6 2 3OutputNOInput10 4 3OutputYES2 92 1010 33 16 108 24 35 66 7Input8 5 3OutputYES2 57 23 73 11 68 74 3

You are given three numbers: $n$, $d$, and $k$.  

Your task is to create a connected graph with the following properties:

* The graph must have $n$ nodes (vertices).
* The longest path between any two nodes in the graph must have $d$ edges. This is called the diameter of the graph.
* Each node in the graph must have a degree of at most $k$ (meaning it is connected to at most $k$ other nodes).

If it is impossible to create such a graph, output "NO". Otherwise, output "YES" and then list the connections (edges) between the nodes.

You are given a number of points and a maximum distance between any two points.  You need to connect the points with lines so that:

* Every point is connected to every other point.
* The longest line between any two points is at most the given maximum distance.
* Each point is connected to at most a given number of other points.

If this is possible, output "YES" and a list of the connections. Otherwise, output "NO".
